ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] problem with transport properties, v 1.3
ygData.msgSnippet: Transport properties are disabled by default, since it takes some time to do the initialization of the transport property routines - fitting polynomials to

Transport properties are disabled by default, since it takes some time  
to do the initialization of the transport property routines - fitting  
polynomials to collision integrals, etc. To enable transport  
properties, specify a transport model when you create the GRI30 object.  
  Currently two transport models are implemented - mixture-averaged  
properties, and multicomponent properties. Both of these models apply  
only to ideal gas mixtures.

To use the mixture-averaged model, do this:

gas = GRI30('Mix')

To use multicomponent properties, do this:

gas = GRI30('Multi')

In either case, functions like

viscosity(gas)

should work as long as a transport model has been specified.  The error  
message you are getting is strange; it should complain about not having  
specified a transport model.

At some point, I plan to restructure the transport property routines,  
so that the two ideal gas transport models are integrated, and  
initialization happens automatically the first time any transport  
property is requested. But for now, you need to remember to specify  
'Mix' or 'Multi'.

You are right about setState_HP.  The incorrect line is Python syntax,  
but is not understood by Matlab. This was corrected a while back, and  
should not be a problem in the current version. You might want to  
install the latest version, or wait until later in the week when I  
release the version that includes support for flames in Matlab.

Dave




On Saturday, May 31, 2003, at 10:36 AM, patcaton75 wrote:

> 1). I believe I must have missed something basic during Cantera
> installation, otherwise more people would be having this problem. I
> cannot access any of the transport properties through Cantera. Typical
> command line prompts as follows:
>
> gas = GRI30;
> viscosity(gas)
>
> ??? Undefined function or variable 'getCanteraError'.
>
> Error in ==> c:\documents and settings\mm\my
> documents\cantera-1.3\cantera\matlab\cantera\@Transport\viscosity.m
> On line 4  ==>    error(getCanteraError);
>
> Similar errors occur for all other transport properties.
>
> 2). I also found what seems to be an obvious error in the m-file code
> for setState_HP.m. After my installation of the matlab toolbox, this
> file had the following line in it:
>
> h, p = hp;
>
> which is simply improper syntax for matlab. In fact, the line wasn't
> really necessary, and removing the line and slightly modifying the
> next allowed the setState_HP command to properly function. I'm
> confused/concerned that my installation seems to be the only one with
> such an error. Has this been seen before?
>
> Any assistance you can provide will be appreciated. I am using Cantera
> v. 1.3; I installed the Matlab toolbox in March, 2003.
>
